translation.ko: 저는 강력 범죄를 수사하며 마약과 갱단 사건을 다뤘죠

translation.en: Many people would say I'm a bit of a shit magnet.
And when I saw the images of the bombing…
my wife said, "Go get those motherfuckers."
[reporter 1] This is the closest you can get
to yesterday's explosions at the Boston Marathon.
translation.ko: 보스턴 마라톤 폭발 현장에 접근 가능한 가장 가까운 지점이죠

translation.en: Security is very tight, as you'd expect.
We still don't know who did what happened yesterday
translation.ko: 누가 그런 일을 했는지는 아직 모릅니다

translation.en: and we still don't know why.
[reporter 2] No arrests have been made. There are no suspects that we know of.
translation.ko: 체포된 사람도 없고 알려진 용의자도 없습니다

translation.en: Two and only two explosive devices were found,
translation.ko: "3명 사망, 176명 부상" 폭발물 2개만 발견되었으며 둘 다 폭파되었습니다

translation.en: and those are the two that both went off.
They did not find any unexploded devices.
[Foley] On Tuesday morning, the evidence response teams
went in and started going through the crime scene.
We had evidence on top of buildings, on windowsills, on top of cars.
translation.ko: 건물 옥상과 창틀, 차 지붕에서 증거물을 수집했습니다

translation.en: It was a huge crime scene, and it was trampled and kicked everywhere.
translation.ko: 거대한 범죄 현장이었고 사방이 짓밟히고 부서져 있었죠

translation.en: We're finding BBs, shrapnel.
The type of shrapnel they saw could not have just been debris lying around,
translation.ko: 발견된 파편은 현장에 떨어진 잔해가 아니라

translation.en: but rather they were, in fact, carpenter nails and BB-like objects.
What they are looking at is how this bomb was put together.
translation.ko: 당국은 폭탄을 제조한 방법을 조사 중입니다

translation.en: What are the materials used? What was the fuse? What was the detonator?
translation.ko: 어떤 재료가 쓰였고 도화선과 기폭 장치는 무엇이었는지 말이죠

translation.en: [Swindon] There were shredded backpacks, as opposed to a backpack that was hit.
translation.ko: 찢어진 배낭들이 있었어요 폭탄을 맞아 훼손된 것과는 달랐죠

translation.en: These were backpacks that we believed held the bombs.
translation.ko: 우린 그 배낭들 안에 폭탄이 있었다고 봤어요

translation.en: The bomb experts are immediately going, "This is a remote-controlled device."
translation.ko: 폭탄 전문가들은 그걸 보자마자 원격 작동 장치라고 말했죠

translation.en: [DesLauriers] As we collected the evidence,
we began to put together the puzzle of these bombs.
The first bomb went off near the finish line.
translation.ko: 첫 번째 폭탄은 결승선 근처에서 터졌죠

translation.en: The second bomb went off about 12 seconds later
translation.ko: 두 번째 폭탄은 12초 후 '더 포럼'이라는 레스토랑 앞에서 터졌어요

translation.en: in front of a restaurant called The Forum restaurant.
Our theory was
that the bombs were transported to the bombing sites in backpacks,
and these were likely pressure cooker bombs with metal fragments inside of them.
translation.ko: 금속 조각이 들어 있는 압력밥솥 폭탄이었다고 추정했죠

translation.en: Pressure cooker bombs are popular terrorist weapons
translation.ko: 압력밥솥 폭탄은 테러범이 많이 쓰는 폭탄입니다

translation.en: because the parts can be bought at different stores.
translation.ko: 여러 상점을 돌며 각각의 부품을 살 수 있으니까요

translation.en: The lid to the pressure cooker used in Monday's bombing
has been found on a nearby rooftop.
[Guthrie] Does this strike you as bearing the hallmarks of some kind of domestic terrorism?
translation.ko: 이 사건이 국내 테러의 특징을 갖고 있다고 보시나요?

translation.en: This is a terrorism investigation. It's a terrorism case.
And whether the politicians are worried about,
"It sounds bad. We don't want to say that."
That's fine, but make no mistake about it, this is a terrorism investigation.
translation.ko: 그건 괜찮은데 이게 테러 수사라는 걸 명심하세요

translation.en: That's why the FBI is running it.
Terrorism is an attack that's motivated by an ideology.
In the Boston Marathon bombings, we didn't know what it was.
translation.ko: 보스턴 마라톤 폭발 사건은 뭔지 알 수가 없었죠

translation.en: But at that time, no matter who was responsible,
we had found the backpacks, we found the pressure cooker bombs.
We found pieces of metal that were inside the pressure cooker bombs.
translation.ko: 압력밥솥 폭탄 안에 있는 금속도 확보한 상태였죠

translation.en: These were clearly designed to maim and kill people.
translation.ko: 사람들을 불구로 만들고 죽이기 위한 목적이 분명했죠

translation.en: So we were comfortable telling the American public
that we suspected this was a terrorist attack.
translation.ko: 테러 공격이 의심된다고 말할 수 있었어요

translation.en: Good morning, everybody.
I've just been briefed by my National Security team,
including FBI Director Mueller, on the attacks in Boston.
translation.ko: 뮬러 FBI 국장도 참석해 보스턴 공격에 관해 브리핑했으며

translation.en: And given what we now know about what took place,
translation.ko: 현재 확보한 정보에 근거해 FBI는 이 사건을

translation.en: the FBI is investigating it as an act of terrorism.
Anytime bombs are used to target innocent civilians,
it is an act of terror.
We still do not know who did this or why,
translation.ko: 누가 그랬는지, 왜 그랬는지는 아직 알 수 없으므로

translation.en: and people shouldn't jump to conclusions before we have all the facts.
translation.ko: 모든 사실이 드러나기 전까지는 성급히 결론 내선 안 될 것입니다

translation.en: But make no mistake, we will get to the bottom of this,
translation.ko: 하지만 우리는 반드시 진상을 규명할 것이며

translation.en: and we will find out who did this. We'll find out why they did this.
translation.ko: 누가 그랬는지 왜 그랬는지 밝혀낼 것입니다

translation.en: 9/11 was a turning point, I think, for all of us.
But particularly for Muslims.
We were shocked to see what had happened.
translation.ko: 우린 그 일로 큰 충격을 받았어요

translation.en: But there was definitely a change.
Certainly to feel as if, all of a sudden, we were the perpetrators.
translation.ko: 갑자기 우리 모두가 가해자가 된 듯한 느낌이었어요

translation.en: It was a difficult time for us.
The essence of Islam is about being a good human being.
translation.ko: 이슬람의 본질은 선한 인간이 되는 거예요 "2001년 9월 11일 오바마 모스크 반대!"

translation.en: We are here as Americans. We are here as part of society.
translation.ko: 우린 미국인이에요 우리도 이 사회의 일부죠

translation.en: But when you don't know about something,
your very first reaction is to fear it.
And that's exactly what had happened with Muslims.
translation.ko: 무슬림이 바로 그런 일을 겪었죠 "국제 코란 불태우기의 날"

translation.en: [chanting] Go home! Go home! Go home!
[woman 1] Go home!
-[woman 2] Get out here! -[woman 1] Go back home!
In a post 9/11 era, the bullying was vicious.
It was consistent. It was every day.
And I was constantly hiding certain aspects of myself,
translation.ko: 저는 끊임없이 저 자신의 특정한 면을 숨기며 지냈어요

translation.en: like, whenever I… navigated life, really.
I moved to Boston when I was seven years old.
translation.ko: 저는 일곱 살 때 보스턴으로 이사했고

translation.en: Two weeks before 9/11.
The kids used to come up to me with fake bombs
translation.ko: 애들이 가짜 폭탄을 들고 저한테 와서

translation.en: and then run away and then make, like, ticking noises.
So, I had a lot of shame being a Muslim.
When the bombing happened, I was in college.
translation.ko: 폭발 사건이 일어났을 때 전 대학생이었어요

translation.en: I remember thinking, "Please don't let it have anything to do with Islam."
translation.ko: 저는 생각했죠, '제발 이슬람과 아무 상관 없는 사건이길'

translation.en: You couldn't help that sinking feeling inside you
uh, to think that maybe this is committed by somebody
who is a Muslim.
[Youssef] Islamophobia was just starting to go away.
translation.ko: 이슬람 혐오가 막 사라지기 시작했던 때였죠

translation.en: I immediately knew that they were going to pin it on Islam.
translation.ko: 즉각적으로 느낌이 왔어요 다들 이슬람을 탓할 것 같았죠

translation.en: [DesLauriers] Once we determined that it was a terrorist event,
the full weight and force of the federal government
was looking for these bombers.
We knew where the bombings took place.
We knew there were businesses located along Boylston Street
translation.ko: 보일스턴가의 사업장 중에는 앞에 CCTV 카메라가 설치된 곳들이 있었어요

translation.en: that had CCTV cameras located on the front of them.
translation.ko: 앞에 CCTV 카메라가 설치된 곳들이 있었어요

translation.en: So we knew that if we looked at it,
we would likely find visual images of the bombers.
translation.ko: 폭파범의 영상을 찾을 수 있을 거라고 생각했죠

translation.en: The first significant piece of evidence was the video coverage from The Forum.
translation.ko: 첫 번째 중요한 증거는 '더 포럼'의 동영상이었어요

translation.en: They had an outdoor camera that was positioned above a door,
translation.ko: 그곳에는 문 위쪽을 촬영하는 옥외 카메라가 있었는데

translation.en: which actually had a vantage point out to where the second explosion went off.
translation.ko: 두 번째 폭발 지점이 잘 보이는 위치였죠

translation.en: And we started processing that very quickly
because we knew that that could contain some significant evidence for us.
We had analysts watching this video repeatedly over and over and over again.
Rewinding, playing it again, rewinding.
Enhancing.
All night long, frame by frame.
There was nothing remarkable about the video at all.
translation.ko: 영상에는 눈에 띄는 게 전혀 없었죠

translation.en: But we got a phone call from a member of the public who said,
translation.ko: 그런데 한 시민이 전화를 걸어서 말했어요

translation.en: "I was across the street, and I have a couple of still shots that you may want."
translation.ko: '제가 길 건너편에서 사진을 몇 장 찍었는데 중요해 보여서요'

translation.en: "These still shots were taken right before the explosion went off."
We had our evidence collection team seize those photos,
and the still shot showed a bag on the ground.
translation.ko: 사진 속에는 바닥에 놓인 가방이 있었어요

translation.en: We time synced that still shot up with the moving video from The Forum,
translation.ko: 사진과 '더 포럼'에서 촬영된 동영상의 싱크를 맞춰 보니

translation.en: and that showed this person who was a little taller than everybody else
translation.ko: 다른 사람들보다 키가 좀 큰 사람이 보였는데 하얀 모자를 쓰고 있었죠

translation.en: and had a white hat on.
I immediately called Rick and I said,
"Rick, you really have to come up to the lab to see this."
translation.ko: 당장 와서 영상을 봐야 한다고 말했어요

translation.en: Kevin Swindon gave me a call, he said, "Boss, I want to show you a video."
translation.ko: 케빈 스윈던이 전화해서 말했죠 '보스, 보여 드릴 영상이 있어요'

translation.en: You see this individual with a white hat walking forward toward the bomb site,
translation.ko: 하얀 모자를 쓴 인물이 폭파 지점 쪽으로 걸어가다가

translation.en: and he stops right by a tree in front of The Forum restaurant.
translation.ko: '더 포럼' 레스토랑 앞의 나무 옆에서 멈추더니

translation.en: And he stands there looking around like anybody else.
Then you see him drop the backpack to the ground and he stands there.
translation.ko: 그러더니 배낭을 땅에 내려놓고 거기 서 있었죠

translation.en: [Swindon] Looks like he's taking pictures of people running. He's texting.
translation.ko: 달리는 사람들의 사진을 찍고 문자를 하는 것 같았어요

translation.en: And then you see the concussive effects of the first bomb going off.
translation.ko: 곧 첫 번째 폭탄이 터지고 모두 놀라는 모습이 보였죠

translation.en: Everybody on the camera looks to the left, and then he just quickly walks to the right.
translation.ko: 다들 왼쪽을 보는데 그 사람은 급히 오른쪽으로 걸어갔어요

translation.en: [woman] Oh my God! Something blew up. Something blew up. Oh my God, something happened.
translation.ko: 맙소사! 뭐가 터졌어 세상에나! 무슨 일이 일어났어

translation.en: And as soon as he leaves the field of view of the camera,
the second bomb goes off right in front of The Forum restaurant.
translation.ko: '더 포럼' 레스토랑 바로 앞에서 두 번째 폭탄이 터졌죠

translation.en: At that point, we knew we had the video of one of the bombers.
translation.ko: 그때 우린 폭파범 한 명의 영상을 확보했다는 걸 확신했어요

translation.en: We called him White Hat.
[Martin] Wednesday is almost like this blackout day because you're not hearing anything,
translation.ko: 수요일은 마치 정전이라도 된 듯이 아무런 소식도 없었어요

translation.en: and then suddenly a press conference that was supposed to begin is canceled.
translation.ko: 그러다 갑자기 예정되었던 기자 회견이 취소된 거예요

translation.en: We are having a press conference.
But now we need more time to prepare. Thank you very much.
-[reporter] What time is it? -I don't know what time.
We made a decision to not have a press conference
because we had discovered the video evidence at that time,
and we had to focus on that first.
But I think that that led to some media speculation
as to what might be going on.
The police were trying to keep a tight lid on information.
translation.ko: 경찰은 정보가 새어 나가지 않게 하려고 애썼어요

translation.en: You saw the void being filled on social media.
Folks were looking at photos saying, "What do you know about this person?"
translation.ko: "R/보스턴폭탄테러범을찾아라" 사람들은 사진을 보며 말했죠 '이 사람 누군지 알아?'

translation.en: The problem with asking that question, though, of course, it is accusatory.
translation.ko: 당연히 그런 질문을 하면 수상하다는 말로 들려요

translation.en: Folks were being pointed at,
and the Boston police were getting a lot of false leads.
Somebody posted a picture of a shadowy figure
translation.ko: 누군가가 옥상을 걷는 어두운 형체의 사진을 올렸어요

translation.en: walking on the rooftop.
It looked like one of these Sasquatch pictures.
And then we receive a picture of a little bag on the racecourse
translation.ko: 폭탄이 터졌던 경주 코스에 있는 작은 가방의 사진도 있었어요

translation.en: where the explosion happened.
And then the bureau did an analysis on it and they said, "No, this was Photoshop."
translation.ko: FBI는 사진을 분석했고 포토샵이라는 결론을 내렸죠

translation.en: That takes investigative resources away from chasing the bad guys.
translation.ko: 범인을 잡기 위한 수사 자원을 낭비한 거예요

translation.en: But that stuff was appearing online.
[Martin] People were sitting in their living rooms, playing detective on social media.
translation.ko: 사람들은 거실에 앉아 소셜 미디어에서 탐정 행세를 했죠

translation.en: It also became an opportunity for bigots
to bask in their assumptions and to propagate those further.
People would say this is clearly the work of Islamic terrorists.
translation.ko: 사람들은 이슬람 테러범의 소행이 분명하다고 했죠

translation.en: And it didn't help that right-wing figures were echoing this.
translation.ko: "보나 마나 아랍인들 탓이야" 우익 인사들이 그 말을 반복하는 것도 도움이 안 됐어요

translation.en: Most terrorists, lately at least, have been Muslim.
They were resparking the flames of Islamophobia throughout the nation.
translation.ko: 전국에 이슬람 혐오의 불길을 다시 지피고 있었어요

translation.en: The news media outlets were not helping.
translation.ko: 언론 기관은 전혀 도움이 안 됐죠

translation.en: Our sources on this story have encouraged us to look deeply
translation.ko: 우리 소식통은 사우디 국적의 이 인물을 심도 있게 조사할 것을 조언했습니다

translation.en: into who this Saudi national is.
[Martin] Even after he was cleared, the media was hounding
translation.ko: 혐의가 없는 게 밝혀졌는데도 언론은 사우디아라비아인을 물고 늘어졌죠, 룸메이트까지요

translation.en: the Saudi Arabian national and even his roommate.
[reporter] Do you know anything about these bombings?
translation.ko: 폭탄 테러에 관해 아는 게 있나요?

translation.en: Do you have anything to do with them? The police came to your apartment.
translation.ko: 본인이나 친구가 연관됐나요? 경찰이 집에 왔었잖아요

translation.en: And then they said someone had been brought down to the federal courthouse.
translation.ko: 그러더니 누가 연방 법원에 출두했다고 했어요

translation.en: There are various media reports that an arrest has been made.
translation.ko: 체포가 이뤄졌다는 여러 언론의 보도가 있었습니다

translation.en: And now there are hundreds of people outside the federal courthouse.
translation.ko: 연방 법원 밖에 수백 명이 진을 치고 있었죠

translation.en: Reporters are everywhere. It's like chaos.
I remember saying, "Ed, is this guy in custody?"
He said, "No, no, I didn't hear."
There was a lot of misinformation. A lot of clamoring to be breaking news.
translation.ko: 잘못된 정보가 많았어요 속보를 내보내고 싶어 안달이었죠

translation.en: [Ortiz] The next thing I know, there's potentially a bomb or some explosive in the area.
translation.ko: 그러더니 그 지역에 무슨 폭탄 아니면 폭약이 있다고 했어요

translation.en: [reporter] After all that commotion, we were given the all clear,
translation.ko: 한바탕 소동이 지나간 후 경찰의 승인이 떨어지자

translation.en: and employees were allowed to go inside, get their belongings,
and then court was closed down for the day.
Authorities stress there is no suspect in custody.
[Evans] There was a lot of misinformation out there being generated.
We had to stay focused on what was real and what wasn't real.
translation.ko: 우린 어떤 게 진짜고 어떤 게 가짜인지에 정신을 집중했죠

translation.en: [DesLauriers] At that point, we knew we had visually identified one of the bombers.
translation.ko: 그때쯤 우린 폭파범 한 명의 인상착의를 확인한 상태였어요

translation.en: The next priority was gathering more video evidence
from along Boylston Street.
Because we wanted to determine if there were any other leads
that could help us identify this individual.
The next critical piece of evidence we gained access to
translation.ko: 우리가 입수했던 증거 중 두 번째로 중요한 증거물은

translation.en: was a video from a business
that was on the corner of Boylston Street, named Whiskey's.
From the video, we were able to time sync it
translation.ko: 우리는 영상의 싱크를 맞춰서 하얀 모자가 코너로 걸어가는 모습을 확인했어요

translation.en: to identify White Hat walking around the corner.
translation.ko: 하얀 모자가 코너로 걸어가는 모습을 확인했어요

translation.en: But we realized there was more to the video.
translation.ko: 그런데 그게 다가 아니라는 걸 깨달았죠

translation.en: He was accompanied by another gentleman with a black hat and a backpack,
translation.ko: 검은 모자를 쓰고 배낭을 멘 다른 남자가 함께 있었어요

translation.en: and they were together.
[Foley] That became its own investigation. We've got them here.
translation.ko: 그 영상 자체로 수사가 됐어요 두 사람이 영상 속에 있는데
